alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued December 18 at 4:36AM PST until December 18 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 15 to 25 mph with peak gusts to 35 to 40 mph. * WHERE...For the Wind Advisory, below passes and canyons. For the frost Advisory in wind-sheltered valleys. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 8 AM PST each morning. For the Wind Advisory, until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
